page.title: 10BLACK HORSE PUB. L. BUZZARD
page.content: The Black Horse, one of the oldest pubs in Leighton Buzzard, stands by an extremely busy junction of the Leighton Ring Road. The 17th century pub in North Street closed in 1979 and re-opened again in February '81 and once again established itself as popular with the younger age group 18-30. The old barn behind the pub was under rennovation into housing accomodation for the landlord when the pub and barn were badly burned in Oct '84 and once again the pub was forced to close. By January 1985 the pub's thatched roof was restored to beauty and the interior ready for re-opening. Now the barn is being restored again but it is doubtful if it will be thatched. Because of financial constraints it is being restored with a view to providing overnight accomodation in the town.
